result.execSummary:
The defendant Kirk C Klossner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs (includes DNA) = $579, due no later than 4pm on 2/19/16. No alternate.

To submit a DNA Sample

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kirk C Klossner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:32 pm [sf]
Defendant Kirk C Klossner in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies DOB and address with the defendant.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited.
Court reviews criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause.

Court requires a $500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Absolute sobriety
-Booking at JCSD today

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Defendant does not wish to be represented by counsel.
Court reviews right to counsel. Mr. Klossner waives this right; Court accepts this waiver finds that it is knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently made and finds him competent to represent himself at this stage of the case.
Plea of "no contest" entered by the defendant
ADA Shock advises that based on the States review they did not determine that there was a victim in this case, based on that information there is victim compliance.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.

Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs (includes DNA) = $579, due no later than 4pm on 2/19/16. No alternate.
To submit a DNA Sample
recess: 3:51 pm
